definition[0]: someone who buys and sells things such as shares in companies or foreign money for other people
definition[1]: someone who arranges sales or business agreements for other people
definition[2]: a person or organization that buys and sells SECURITIES, currencies, property, insurance etc for others
example[1]: The success of Independent Insurance comes from a close relationship with its brokers, who take a commission for acting as go-betweens with clients.
definition[3]: to arrange the details of a deal etc so that everyone can agree to it
example[3]: Ovitz brokered the multibillion-dollar Japanese acquisitions of Columbia and MCA.
